title: Ranking the top 25 MLB offseason trade candidates -- and finding their best fits
content: From All-Star outfielders to elite aces, here are the big names your team could be targeting this winter.

title: LSU's Kiffin to let Weis Jr. coach Ole Miss in CFP
content: LSU assistant Charlie Weis Jr., who is part of new coach Lane Kiffin's staff with the Tigers, will be allowed to return to Ole Miss and serve as offensive coordinator through the College Football Playoff.

title: Sitake intends to remain at BYU, sources say
content: BYU coach Kalani Sitake intends to remain at the school, sources tell ESPN's Pete Thamel, with the school preparing a lucrative contract extension for the Cougars' coach.

title: Steelers claim veteran WR Thielen, cut CB Slay
content: The Steelers claimed wide receiver Adam Thielen off waivers Tuesday and waived veteran cornerback Darius Slay.

title: Serena on return rumors: 'I'm NOT coming back.'
content: Serena Williams, 44, is disputing talk that she is planning to resume her tennis career, which came about when she reentered the International Tennis Integrity Agency's doping test pool. The 23-time major champ posted her comeback denial on X.

title: No. 5 Texas Tech extends McGuire with 7-year deal
content: Texas Tech and coach Joey McGuire have agreed in principle to a new seven-year deal that sources told ESPN is worth an average of nearly $7 million per year.

title: Buckeyes' Day had Plan B for headset outage
content: Ohio State coach Ryan Day said he had a hunch that the Buckeyes would lose headset communication Saturday at Michigan, which led him to have a backup plan ready.

title: Sources: Pels' Williamson out at least 3 weeks
content: New Orleans Pelicans star Zion Williamson has a grade 2 right hip adductor strain, the team announced on Tuesday.

title: Mora promises CSU he'll win titles, scale peaks
content: Jim Mora says the prospect of coaching at Colorado State first piqued his interest six years ago, and his bold promises Tuesday included winning a title Pac-12, competing for a national title and climbing the state's 54 14,000-foot mountains.

title: Can Texas make the playoff? Can any team win the ACC?
content: Why the Buckeyes are so dominant, the ACC is so confusing and the playoff picture still isn't settled.

title: New NFL Power Rankings: Let's stack the entire league 1-32 -- and pick out late-season X factors
content: See our latest rankings ahead of Week 14. We also picked out X factors for the last five weeks of the regular season.

title: Bracketology: Texas moves up to No. 2 overall, but UCLA is the 1-seed to watch
content: The Bruins suffered their first loss and got leapfrogged by Texas. But UCLA has Quad 1 wins and more depth on the way.

title: A brawl, a shark attack and an MVP: The final run of The Rooster
content: What was Danilo Gallinari, who earned more than $200M in the NBA, doing in Puerto Rico? Ending a decades-long chase.

title: From bed rest to champion: Chet Holmgren is just getting started
content: Holmgren was sidelined for three months last season because of a fractured pelvis and is "chasing for more" this season.

title: Will Brandon Aiyuk return for the 49ers this season? Answering five top questions
content: San Francisco voided Aiyuk's contract guarantees for next year. What does that mean for 2025 and beyond?

title: Two vulnerable NFL sack records: Tracking pace for Myles Garrett (19!), Broncos' D (51!)
content: The Browns vet edge rusher and Denver's defense are on pace to rewrite the single-season sacks record book. Here's where things stand.

title: Tracking all the firings and hirings
content: With the college football coaching carousel fully in motion, here's a recap of every FBS vacancy and hiring.

title: How the U23s can boost USWNT options for World Cup 2027
content: Emma Hayes has revitalized the U.S. U23 pathway and a win over England showed how it will help her options ahead of the 2027 World Cup.

title: Even without Aitana Bonmatí, Spain still show why they are best in the world
content: Spain cap off the year winning the UEFA Women's Nations League, cementing their spot as the world's best team.

title: Why Christian Pulisic might be in the midst of his best season as a pro -- and why it might not last
content: The U.S. men's national team star is having a career season in Italy with AC Milan. What has changed for Christian Pulisic?

title: Rankings for Week 14
content: Weekly individual and composite rankings for each position in PPR and IDP formats, as well as Eric Karabell's superflex ranks.

title: Free agents: Kyle Monangai, Bam Knight are essential pickups
content: All the free agent options worth adding heading into Week 14 and the start of the fantasy football playoff season.

title: How to bet the Heisman Trophy race, which comes down to the Big Ten championship game
content: With the race expected to come down to Indiana QB Fernando Mendoza and Ohio State QB Julian Sayin, the Big Ten championship game likely determines who wins the Heisman Trophy.

title: The NHL's best this week: Kyle Palmieri, 'hockey guy'
content: The Islanders forward tore his ACL -- then made a brilliant pass to set up a goal. Plus, what to watch this week.

title: How a bald coach solved volleyball's ponytail predicament
content: The NCAA volleyball tournament will feature dozens of stars wearing a hair-tie solution invented by none other than three-time champion Jerritt Elliott.

title: Huskers earn top overall seed in NCAA tournament
content: Undefeated Nebraska earned the No. 1 overall seed in the NCAA women's volleyball tournament bracket released Sunday.

title: WNBA, union agree to 40-day extension on CBA
content: The WNBA and WNBA Players Association agreed to a 40-day extension on the current CBA that includes the option for either party to terminate the extension with 48 hours' notice.

title: Athletes Unlimited Softball League: Expansion and allocation draft
content: Who went No. 1 overall? Where did Maya Brady end up? All you need to know about the first AUSL player draft.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man United lead race for Gallagher
content: Manchester United, Newcastle, Everton and Tottenham Hotspur are all interested in signing Atlético Madrid midfielder Conor Gallagher. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: BJP bags 83% of Rs 915cr routed via Tata Group-controlled trust
content: Political donations via electoral trusts reveal the BJP received a substantial Rs 959 crore in 2024-25, with the Tata group's Progressive Electoral Trust contributing Rs 757.6 crore. While Congress secured over Rs 313 crore through trusts, its overall contributions are significantly lower than bond receipts in previous years. Other parties also received smaller allocations.

title: Sanchar Saathi row: Govt says users can delete app; Cong cries snooping
content: Government clarifies users can uninstall the Sanchar Saathi app, despite mandatory pre-installation for manufacturers. Communications Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia assured the app protects against cyber fraud, refuting snooping concerns. Critics, including Congress, view it as an invasion of privacy, while global tech giants express alarm over potential security risks.

title: Democracy, drugs or oil? Why Trump is gunning for Venezuela's Maduro - explained
content: The US has escalated its military presence in the Caribbean, deploying warships and aircraft near Venezuela, citing a war on narco-terrorism. However, the scale of the operation and questionable drug seizure data suggest a broader strategy aimed at regime change in Caracas.

title: Google's Gemini forces Sam Altman to send 'Code Red' warning to employees
content: OpenAI faces an internal 'code red' as Google's Gemini surges ahead, forcing a halt on revenue plans to fix ChatGPT's performance. Google's integrated infrastructure and custom chips give it a decisive edge. OpenAI's pivot highlights intense competition and financial pressures, as it scrambles to regain ground against a resurgent tech giant.

title: Military pact: Russia opens ports, airspace to Indian warships & planes; what it means
content: Russia's State Duma has ratified a major military logistics pact with India, the Reciprocal Exchange of Logistic Support (RELOS). This agreement allows both nations' military forces to utilize each other's facilities for joint exercises, humanitarian operations, and disaster relief, strengthening their strategic partnership ahead of President Putin's visit.

title: Virat Kohli to play in Vijay Hazare trophy after 15 years; DDCA confirms
content: Virat Kohli will feature in the Vijay Hazare Trophy starting December 24, marking his return to domestic cricket after over a decade.  DDCA president Rohan Jaitley confirmed his availability, anticipating a significant boost for the Delhi team.  This move follows his ODI hundred against South Africa and comes as domestic participation becomes compulsory for contracted players.

title: American VC Garry Tan says Zoho will 'perish'; founder Sridhar Vembu hits back
content: Zoho's chief, Sridhar Vembu, has passionately responded to the forecasts made by Y Combinator's Garry Tan, which suggest that AI's 'vibe coding' could extinguish the flame of Indian SaaS innovators. Vembu emphasized the strong trajectory of Zoho's customer base, casting doubt on the effectiveness of AI-generated applications for the nuanced requirements of businesses and raising alarms about potential technological debt.

title: Punjab shocker: Gang war at wedding leaves 2 guests dead, 1 injured
content: Two wedding guests were killed and one injured in a violent clash between two notorious criminal gangs at a resort in Ludhiana. The incident occurred during a wedding function on Pakhowal Road, where invited guests, including VIPs and MLAs, were present. Police have registered a case against identified accused and their accomplices for murder and rioting.

title: Europe-Russia war? Putin says Moscow is 'ready' - what triggered shock remark
content: Russian President Vladimir Putin stated Moscow is ready for conflict if Europe initiates it, accusing European governments of hindering peace efforts in Ukraine. US special envoy Steve Witkoff and Jared Kushner are in Moscow to advance a peace plan, facing objections from European nations and Ukraine over territorial concessions and military limits.

title: Thousands of Amazon employees send open letter to CEO; question layoffs
content: Over 1,000 Amazon employees have penned an open letter expressing grave concerns about the company's rapid AI development. They warn of significant damage to democracy, jobs, and the environment, arguing that Amazon is sacrificing climate goals and human workers for AI dominance. The employees demand ethical AI practices, including clean energy use and employee involvement in AI decisions.

title: Defer Maharashtra civic pollsphase 1 results till Dec 21: High court
content: The Bombay high court has halted the announcement of first-phase municipal poll results, scheduled for December 3rd. Justices Anil Kilor and Rajnish Vyas ruled that releasing these outcomes prematurely could unfairly influence the second phase of voting on December 20th. The court mandated that all results be declared together on December 21st, ensuring electoral fairness and transparency.

title: Stephen Curry shares the moment he knew Ayesha was ‘the one’ amid her remarks
content: Stephen Curry revealed a pivotal moment from his early dating days with Ayesha, where she encouraged him to stay in school, solidifying his belief in her unwavering support. This heartwarming recollection comes amidst recent fan backlash over Ayesha's "Call Her Daddy" podcast comments, which some perceive as disrespectful to Stephen's commitment.

title: Nina Lin banned on Twitch again after Target shoplifting clip goes viral
content: Twitch streamer Nina Lin has been banned for the third time, with the latest suspension occurring on December 2, 2025. This ban follows a viral video where viewers accused her of shoplifting from a Target store during a livestream. Her ambiguous response to the incident intensified online discussion and scrutiny.

title: Mark Andrews gets engaged to Elena Yates as fans troll him over Lamar drop
content: Ravens tight end Mark Andrews faces relentless fan criticism for a past playoff fumble, even after a strong 2025 season. Despite his consistent performance and a recent engagement, online trolls continue to mock him, referencing the dropped pass. Andrews previously explained the incident was due to wet gloves, but the public's memory remains unforgiving.

title: By the drivers, for the drivers: Bharat Taxi starts Delhi, Gujarat trials
content: Bharat Taxi is making waves across India as it gears up to launch its innovative driver-owned ride-hailing app nationwide. With an impressive roster of over 51,000 drivers in its pilot phase, this groundbreaking cooperative model stands as the first of its kind globally, ensuring that every fare goes directly to the drivers.

title: Himalayan black bear enters Kashmir University, SKIMS; wildlife dept sets trap cages
content: Panic gripped Srinagar as a Himalayan black bear was sighted at the University of Kashmir and later at SKIMS hospital, nearly 10km apart. Wildlife officials are deploying traps and drones to capture the elusive animal. Increased sightings are attributed to climate change and readily available food sources like garbage, disrupting hibernation patterns.

title: Saudi bus tragedy: Lone survivor recounts horror; pleads for support
content: The sole survivor of a Saudi bus accident, Mohammed Abdul Shoaib, recounted how a tanker struck their vehicle, causing it to erupt in flames and kill 45 passengers, including his family. He escaped through a window as the bus caught fire, but his clothes ignited. Shoaib, now without support, has appealed to the Telangana government for a job.

title: Assam: Tezpur central varsity logjam continues; students shut down campus
content: Tezpur University is experiencing significant unrest as students engage in protests, securing building entrances and calling for the dismissal of VC Shambhu Nath Singh due to allegations of misconduct and a lack of respect for student voices. Nearly all academic and administrative functions have ground to a halt, affecting a vast number of students.

title: Watch: DRDO tests fighter jet ejection system; Rajnath Singh hails milestone
content: India has achieved a significant milestone in indigenous defence capabilities with a successful high-speed rocket-sled test of a fighter aircraft escape system. This dynamic trial, conducted by DRDO, validated canopy severance, ejection sequencing, and aircrew recovery, placing India among nations with advanced in-house testing. The test simulated real-life conditions, marking a step towards self-reliance in defence.

title: Giannis shocks fans with sudden social-media purge amid Bucks exit rumors
content: Milwaukee Bucks fans are concerned as Giannis Antetokounmpo has significantly altered his social media, removing most team-related posts. This, coupled with the Bucks' poor season performance and recent losses, has fueled speculation about a potential trade. Despite past loyalty, the team's struggles and Giannis's desire for championships are raising alarms.

title: Glitch hits airports again: Check-ins affected; Air India issues advisory to flyers
content: Air India has issued a travel advisory urging passengers to confirm flight status before airport arrival due to a third-party system outage impacting check-in operations and causing widespread delays. The airline's teams are working to restore services and minimize passenger inconvenience. Travelers are advised to allow extra time for their journeys.

title: Delhi pollution nears 'severe' again: AQI rises to 372
content: Delhi is grappling with alarming air quality, as the AQI spikes to 372, perilously close to the 'severe' classification. More than 15 areas have hit this alarming benchmark. Experts warn that this 'very poor' air pollution is likely to linger for several days, compounded by nightly patterns of mist and haze.

title: 'Imran Khan alive but...': Sister Uzma meets jailed leader; big charge against Munir
content: Imran Khan's sister, Uzma Khanum, confirmed the former Pakistan PM is "completely fine" after a rare jail visit. Weeks of restricted access had sparked protests and death rumours. Despite court orders, family and party leaders faced repeated denials, leading to legal challenges and allegations of police brutality against protesting sisters. PTI seeks regular, unhindered access.

title: What's brewing? Kohli ignores Gambhir, Rohit stops for a quick chat ahead of 2nd ODI
content: Virat Kohli looked sharp and assertive, taking on throw-down experts Raghu (right-arm) and Nuwan Seneviratne (left-arm), who pushed the pace throughout the session. The battle was compelling to watch — Kohli found the middle of the bat repeatedly, though there were moments when Raghu’s extra pace beat him. Head coach Gautam Gambhir stood positioned between the two nets, observing the session closely.

title: CM Kar'nataka': Sidda, DKS make a meal of it; clean up left for Cong high command
content: Karnataka's chief ministerial post remains undecided as Siddaramaiah and Deputy CM D.K. Shivakumar's "breakfast diplomacy" yields no timeline from the party high command. Both leaders project unity, calling for a peaceful settlement amidst ongoing speculation. Siddaramaiah's cryptic "politics is not permanent" comment further fuels discussions about a potential leadership change.

title: Rohit-Virat in focus as India brace for Proteas fightback in Raipur
content: India secured a 17-run victory in the first ODI against South Africa, fueled by Virat Kohli's century and Rohit Sharma's fifty. However, off-field tensions regarding World Cup selections and unsettled team combinations persist as India prepares for the second ODI in Raipur.

title: Sri Lanka aid: India rejects Pak's 'ridiculous' flight claim; netizens mock 'expired' relief
content: Pakistan accused India of delaying its humanitarian aid to Sri Lanka, claiming airspace permission was withheld. India refuted these allegations, stating the request was processed within four hours. Meanwhile, Pakistan's High Commission in Sri Lanka faced online criticism over relief packages with apparent near-expiry dates.

title: Trump sanctions: Crude imports from Russia at a high - can it continue?
content: India's Russian crude imports are set to dip following US sanctions on major oil firms, but a permanent shift is unlikely. Refiners are strategically sourcing from non-sanctioned Russian entities and other global suppliers. Despite temporary disruptions, India's demand for cost-effective Russian oil, coupled with emerging workarounds, suggests continued, albeit indirect, procurement.

title: After Ranchi run-fest, what will Ro-Ko do in Raipur ODI? Former SA legend predicts
content: Dale Steyn anticipates a continued strong performance from Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma in the second ODI against South Africa. He also believes Quinton de Kock will be motivated to score big after a first-ball duck, highlighting his impressive recent form and strong record against India.

title: Does Harshit Rana get preferential treatment from Gambhir? Pacer breaks silence
content: Fast bowler Harshit Rana dismissed claims of preferential treatment under head coach Gautam Gambhir, stating he focuses solely on his on-field performance. Rana, who debuted across formats during Gambhir's tenure, emphasized his commitment to hard work and avoiding external noise. He is actively working with bowling coach Morne Morkel and Arshdeep Singh to enhance his new-ball skills.

title: 'Space teaches you to adapt': Grp Cpt Shukla on what ISS got right, what India can learn
content: Group Captain Shubhanshu Shukla reflects on his ISS mission, highlighting its success as a model of international cooperation and scientific advancement. His insights offer valuable lessons for India's own long-term human spaceflight strategy, emphasizing modularity, flexibility, and clear objectives for the upcoming Bharatiya Antariksh Station.

title: Rupee tumbles to hit life-time low! Currency nears the 90 per dollar mark
content: The Indian rupee hit an all-time low of 89.95 against the US dollar, driven by speculators and importers. Experts cite a strong dollar and delayed trade deal as key factors. While some foresee appreciation with a trade deal, others expect continued volatility around the 90-per-dollar mark.

title: Ro-Ko mania hits Raipur! Virat Kohli goes big, Rohit Sharma takes notes - WATCH
content: Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma showcased impressive form in training ahead of the second ODI against South Africa in Raipur. Following a thrilling 17-run victory in Ranchi, where the duo starred with a century and a sixes record respectively, India aims to extend their series lead.

title: Candace Owens fires back after France rejects her Macron–Kirk claim over typo
content: Candace Owens claims French officials are using a minor spelling error to dismiss her serious allegations of a plot against Charlie Kirk and her own safety. She argues the focus on 'Riley' versus 'Ripley' distracts from her core claims about French Legionnaire involvement and questions about individuals present at a Utah event. Owens awaits a response from the FBI.

title: 'Chor ki daadhi mein tinka': BJP defends Sanchar Saathi app; jabs Cong over privacy row
content: Bharatiya Janata Party has responded to Congress accusations regarding the Sanchar Saathi app. BJP leaders stated the app aims to protect users from fraud and crime, not to monitor them. They emphasised that the application can be removed by users. Congress had alleged the directive was dictatorial and called the app a snooping tool.

title: Matthews’ captaincy questioned as ex-GM hints Leafs picked the wrong leader
content: Former executive Gord Stellick questions Auston Matthews' captaincy, suggesting leadership and talent are not synonymous. He believes the team lost its compass after the shift, with John Tavares' quiet professionalism now seen as a potential stabilizing force. The current leadership faces a critical test to steer the team back to resilience.

title: Putin's talks with U.S. envoy Witkoff, Kushner conclude, the Kremin says
content: The talks on a possible way to end the deadliest European conflict since World War Two stretched for nearly five hours

title: India trashes Pakistan's claim of denial of overflight to send aid to Sri Lanka
content: The request for overflight clearance for a Pakistani aircraft carrying humanitarian assistance to Sri Lanka was received by the Indian high commission in Islamabad at around 1 p.m. on December 1, Randhir Jaiswal said

title: People should disclose details as per Census Act: Home Ministry
content: Minister of State for Home Nityanand Rai’s reply comes in response to a Trinamool MP’s query on disclosure of caste

title: J&K government submits proposal to relax age requirements for jobs to L-G
content: According to job aspirants, the past six years have seen the cancellation of many selection lists and many lists faced legal challenges

title: Over 90 laws still discriminate against people with leprosy, NHRC tells Supreme Court
content: The top court was hearing a batch of petitions contending that such statutory provisions discriminate against persons affected by leprosy in ways that entrench stigma and undermine their dignity

title: ‘Waiting for her to walk through the door’: father of woman pushed into Bangladesh
content: Bhodu Sheikh has been fighting for the return of his daughter’s family since they, along with another family — Sweety Bibi , her husband and their two children — were pushed across the border on June 27 after being picked up by the Delhi Police on June 18 on charges of being illegal Bangladeshi citizens.

title: Three injured as wall collapses on makeshift eatery in Chennai’s Dashamakan
content: Fire and rescue service personnel and Purasawalkam Tahsildar Kuppammal Ramu were at the site soon after the incident

title: Bengaluru police book unknown person for hoax email to Kempegowda International Airport, shopping malls
content: The Bengaluru police received a mail on their official address threatening to carry out a series of bomb blasts at Kempegowda International Airport and several major shopping malls in the city, which after verification was termed as a hoax

title: Flight disruptions at  Kempegowda International Airport due to technical and operational reasons
content: There were flight disruptions at the Kempegowda International Airport on Tuesday owing to technical and operational reasons

title: Karnataka High Court finds no procedural lapses in extending time to submit chargesheet in murder case in which MLA Basavaraj is accused
content: The provisions of the Karnataka Control of Organized Crime Act (KCOCA) has been invoked against all the accused

title: Experts push for integrative approach to obesity, metabolic disorders at Ayurveda meet
content: As metabolic diseases surge worldwide, experts called for stronger evidence-based integration of Ayurveda with modern medicine at a two-day international conference on Ayurveda and Integrative Approaches to Obesity and Metabolic Syndrome

title: ‘Unacceptable’, say MEA officials after envoys of U.K., France and Germany author anti-Putin article
content: The article blamed Russia for the war in Ukraine and accused Putin of “total disregard for human life”

title: Farmer, two sons electrocuted after stepping on illegal electrical fence in Vellore
content: As they were checking different plant species at various spots in the nursery, Janakiraman accidentally stepped on a snapped live electric wire in the farm nursery.

title: Two persons killed in road accident near Ambur on Chennai - Bengaluru Highway
content: Police said that along with his mother in-law, Divyaman and his wife were on their way to Vellore in their car when Lovely, who was driving the vehicle, reportedly lost control of the vehicle and hit a parked lorry on the stretch.

title: Five Kargil councillors move J&K HC against Ladakh L-G order which nominated a Muslim to the council
content: ‘The seat is reserved for a member of the “principle religious minority” from the region and Buddhists, not Muslims, are the largest minority group in Kargil.’

title: Define 'fake news', amend penal provisions to take action: Parliamentary panel
content: "There is also a need to amend the penal provisions for publishing/telecasting fake news in relevant Acts/Rules/Guidelines for each form of media (print, electronic, digital),"says Parliamentary Standing Committee

title: J&K Deputy CM moves Delhi HC for removal of objectionable content against him on social media
content: Surinder Kumar Choudhary has claimed that there is alleged defamatory content with sexual undertones on several social media platforms, including Facebook and YouTube channels, against him

title: Defence Minster says 130th Constitutional Amendment will be part of Patel’s legacy
content: Bill mandates that any public officeholder required to remain in jail for more than 30 days must resign

title: J&K High Court allows PDP MLA Waheed Parra to travel outside Union Territory
content: Court modifies bail conditions for PDP legislator facing UAPA case, permits domestic travel with prior intimation

title: India-Maldives joint military exercise begins in Thiruvananthapuram
content: The exercise will include tactical drills, joint mission planning and exchange of best practices, aimed at improving coordinated responses to shared security challenges

title: Delhi riots case: No ‘regime change’ claim in charge sheet, activists tell Supreme Court
content: The Delhi Police’s claim of a coordinated ‘regime change operation’ behind the February 2020 Delhi riots finds no mention in the chargesheet, even though it was now being projected as a central plank of the prosecution’s case, the petitioners said

title: West Bengal announces compensation linked to SIR-related distress
content: “39 deaths and several illness cases have been reported amid stress surrounding the Special Intensive Revision process,” says Mamata Banerjee

title: ‘India should focus on building national aircraft’
content: Aequs invests ₹600 crore in consumer electronics plant in Hubballi to manufacture portable computer parts, smart devices and multipurpose wearables

title: Assam Congress chief seeks PM’s intervention in Tezpur University unrest
content: Gaurav Gogoi flags allegations of mismanagement, administrative lapses and financial irregularities as Central varsity remains shut

title: Political interests are creating linguistic divisions, says Education Minister
content: ‘We firmly believe that multi-lingualism is our strength and not a liability,’ Dharmendra Pradhan said at the inauguration of the fourth edition of the Kashi Tamil Sangamam

title: Rajya Sabha proceedings disrupted as Opposition parties continue protest
content: It “may not be appropriate” to hold a debate on “electoral reforms” before a discussion on 150 years of the Vande Mataram, says Kiren Rijiju; RS Chair rejects 20 Opposition notices for discussions under Rule 267

title: Trump Says He Doesn't Want Somalis In US, Calls Ilhan Omar "Garbage"
content: Donald Trump during a lengthy Cabinet meeting on Tuesday said he did not want Somali immigrants in the US, saying residents of the war-ravaged eastern African country are too reliant on US social safety net and add little to the United States.

title: Afghan Man Who Shot National Guard Members Pleads Not Guilty
content: An Afghan man accused of shooting two members of the National Guard near the White House, killing one, pleaded not guilty on Tuesday to murder charges, US media said.

title: Friends Behead UP Man With Axe Over Money Dispute
content: A 20-year-old youth was brutally murdered in Gorakhpur, allegedly by his friends, who beheaded him and dumped his head and torso in the neighbouring Maharajganj district, police said on Tuesday.

title: "Cried Too Much While Living": UP Constable Uploads Video, Dies By Suicide
content: A 30-year-old constable posted with UP-112 was found hanging in his rented accommodation in Kanpur on Tuesday, an official said.

title: Pollution Worsens In Delhi, Air Quality 'Severe' In Most Parts
content: Air quality in Delhi deteriorated further on Tuesday evening, reaching an AQI of 372 and edging closer to the 'severe' mark, with more than 15 locations already in that category.

title: 13-Year-Old Karnataka Girl Raped After Being Dragged Into Field, 2 Arrested
content: In a shocking incident reported from the Belagavi district of Karnataka on Tuesday, a 13-year-old girl was dragged into a sugarcane field and raped.

title: Dead Frog Found In Mid-Day Meal In Madhya Pradesh School
content: A dead frog was allegedly found in the midday meal served to children at a government-run primary school in Gokulpur area here, an official said.

title: Class 8 Boy Hit In Head By Air-Gun Pellet At School Fest, Undergoes Surgery
content: A school science exhibition outing turned frightening for an 8th-grade student after an air-gun pellet struck him in the head during a fest held on the same campus.

title: TVK's "Reckless Actions", Intentional Delay By Vijay Caused Stampede: Tamil Nadu To Top Court
content: The Tamil Nadu government has told the Supreme Court that the Karur stampede in which 41 people were killed is attributable to a series of "reckless and uncoordinated actions" by the organisers and workers of the TVK party.

title: Video: Sena MLA Enters Poll Booth, Shows Party Symbol To Woman Casting Vote
content: An offence was filed against Shiv Sena MLA Santosh Bangar in Maharashtra's Hingoli district allegedly for sloganeering and breaching confidentiality by showing party election symbol to a woman casting vote during local body polls

title: India Joins Elite Club As Research Body Tests Fighter Jet Escape System
content: The DRDO has successfully conducted a high-speed rocket-sledge test of a fighter aircraft escape system at controlled velocity, validating some of the key safety parameters, including complete aircrew recovery.

title: Abandoned In Cold, Newborn Finds Unlikely Protectors In Pack Of Stray Dogs
content: In the hours before dawn, when most of this river town in West Bengal's Nadia district lies silent under a winter sky, a newborn baby was left alone on the cold ground outside a bathroom in a railway workers' colony.

title: "Albatross Around Neck Of Opposition": KTR's Sharp Attack On Rahul Gandhi
content: KT Rama Rao, the second in command of Telangana's opposition Bharat Rashtra Samithi, attacked the Congress and its senior leader Rahul Gandhi today, saying he "has become an albatross around the neck of Opposition".

title: Revanth Reddy's Remarks On Hindu Gods Spark Political Row
content: Telangana Chief Minister Revanth Reddy's lighthearted remarks about 3 crore Hindu deities, a God for every occasion, have sparked a political row.

title: Another Woman Accuses Kerala MLA Rahul Mamkootathil Of Sex Assault, Files Case
content: With police continuing their intensive search for missing Congress MLA Rahul Mamkootathil, another woman has filed a fresh sexual assault complaint against the legislator.

title: Drunk Man, 21, Dies After Falling Headlong Into Fire Pit While Sleeping
content: A 21-year-old man has died after falling headlong into a brazier while sleeping in an inebriated state in his rented room near Malibu Towne here, police said on Tuesday.

title: Tableaus Around Neck, Madhya Pradesh MLAs Call Attention To Farmer Distress
content: The second day of the Madhya Pradesh Assembly session saw a unique protest as the Congress launched an offensive against the ruling BJP government over the worsening condition of farmers in the state.

title: Flights Of Multiple Airlines Delayed After Check-In Glitch At Many Airports
content: Air India announced late Tuesday evening that check-in systems at all airports are "functioning normally" and its "flights are operating as per schedule" after a brief outage that delayed flights across airports.

title: Man Released A Day After His Arrest By CBI In 36-Year-Old Kidnapping Case
content: A court on Tuesday released a man who was arrested a day before by the CBI for his alleged "involvement" in the kidnapping of Rubaiyya Sayeed, daughter of then Union home minister Mufti Mohammed Sayeed in 1989, in a big faux pas for the agency.

title: "I Am Not a Terrorist": Sharjeel Imam To Top Court During Bail Plea Hearing
content: Seeking bail in the February 2020 Delhi riots case, activist Sharjeel Imam on Tuesday expressed anguish before the Supreme Court over being "labelled" a "dangerous intellectual terrorist" without a full-fledged trial or a single conviction.

title: Kuki body asks NHRC to reject Manipur govt. action taken reports denying State complicity
content: In the reports, the Manipur government has said that allegations that the State ‘chooses to support and assist’ militants/terrorist groups of the dominant community were ‘wrong and misconceived’

title: RSS’s farmers’ body asks Centre to ban land pooling, seeks uniform land acquisition law
content: ‘Concerned about the lack of attention to the interests of villages and farmers affected by the acquisition of agricultural land across the country’

title: DRDO conducts successful high speed test of indigenous fighter escape system
content: Rocket sled trial in Chandigarh validates canopy severance, ejection sequencing and aircrew recovery for Light Combat Aircraft escape system

title: ED notice in masala bond a result of CPI(M)-BJP nexus, alleges Adoor Prakash
content: UDF convener says LDF long practised voter fraud and that the Sabarimala gold heist probe being sabotaged

title: Bengal SIR: 2,208 polling booths under ECI scanner for 100% digitisation, ‘zero dead, duplicate voters’
content: In total, over 7,000 polling booths in West Bengal have recorded only a handful of uncollectable forms from among thousands of electors, sources say

title: DSEL steps in to prevent stray dog infestation in all educational institutions in Karnataka
content: Animal activists, however, have expressed strong opposition to the relocation of stray dogs and urged the DSEL to withdraw the circular.

title: New rape allegation against Mamkootathil wrong-foots UDF ahead of local body polls
content: The petitioner emails KPCC president accusing  Mamkootathil of raping her after inviting her to a resort to discuss a prospective marriage

title: MP flags crisis claiming two lakh kirana stores shut down nation-wide
content: Kumar Naik welcomes the 30% procurement rule for Single Brand Retail under FDI norms as it strengthens sourcing from MSMEs, local producers

title: CICT to launch free online course to learn Tamil through Hindi
content: The Central Institute of Classical Tamil (CICT), Chennai, introduce similar courses for learning Tamil through other languages, including Malayalam, Kannada, Telugu and even English

title: Another mobile phone found inside Parappana Agrahara prison; fourth FIR filed
content: Four days after a series of raids led to the recovery of over 50 mobile phones and an equal number of SIM cards, officials at the Central Prison have found yet another mobile phone with a SIM card concealed inside the washroom of Barrack C, Tower 2

title: Telangana sets sight on silver economy leadership
content: Roadmap stresses on innovation in elder care, health tech, assistive devices and age-friendly digital services

title: U.P. reports highest number of complaints over ‘shoddy’ Jal Jeevan Mission work
content: Action had been taken against 621 Departmental Officials, 969 contractors, and 153 Third Party Inspection Agencies (TPIAs), the Minister of State for Jal Shakti, V Somanna, said

title: Vaikunta Dwara Darshan in Tirumala: 1.76 lakh devotees selected in ‘e-dip’
content: The pilgrims will have darshan on the first three days of the 10-day festivities beginning December 30; during the subsequent seven days, devotees will be allowed for Vaikunta Dwara Darshan without any kind of darshan ticket

title: SIR hearing: Can ‘doubt’ of impurity in voter rolls lead to statelessness, ask petitioners
content: Supreme Court hears arguments that the Special Intensive Revision allows mass scrutiny of citizenship based on mere suspicion, posing threats of disenfranchisement and statelessness

title: YouTubers cannot harm business in the guise of reviewing products: Madras High Court
content: Justice N. Senthilkumar directs YouTube LLC to block a video review of a water energiser on one of its channels

title: Cyclone Ditwah’s unusual stall leads to prolonged rains in Tamil Nadu
content: While the system was expected to move away from T.N. coast by Monday, it remained stationary for several hours and drew in more moisture, generating fresh bands of rain-bearing clouds

title: ‘Rythanna Meekosam’ workshops in Andhra Pradesh on December 3
content: Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu to participate in the session to be organised at the Nallajerla Rythu Seva Kendra in East Godavari district

title: Russia focused on increasing trade with India despite ‘obstacles’ by third countries: Dmitry Peskov
content: Kremlin spokesperson said the share of U.S. dollars in global trade is ‘decreasing’ and that of national currencies in global trade is ‘increasing’; he says upcoming visit of Russian President Vladmir Putin to India will include a proposal on setting up small modular reactors

title: Telangana launches six-week ‘Fraud Ka Full Stop’ campaign
content: SPARC Cyber Clubs (Student Program for Awareness and Responsible Cyberspace) in schools and colleges and SBI Cyber Defenders aimed at improving preventive vigilance among bank staff and vulnerable customers were also introduced at launch

title: Governor orders V-Cs to enforce hostel discipline, decides to form panel to curb campus violence
content: Mohanan Kunnummal to head panel to recommend suggestions to contain violence on university and academic campuses

title: IT Minister reviews preparations for TG Rising Global Summit
content: Urges officials to ensure the event is organised in a manner that captures global attention and strengthens Telangana’s international brand image

title: Agniveer Combat Spectacle brings patriotic fervour to Artillery Centre Hyderabad
content: In one of the most animated segments of the evening, the Agniveers performed a sequence of floor exercises and stunts in their physical training uniforms

title: Govt. authorises CRDA to launch LPS 2.0 in seven villages in Amaravati capital region
content: It is to facilitate urban infrastructure and planned development in the capital region, strengthening the State’s ongoing efforts to accelerate Amaravati’s growth trajectory

title: BRS to step up struggle against HILTP with visits to clusters planned for land use change
content: Working president of the party KTR says 8 fact-finding teams of the party to visit industrial clusters notified under the policy on Dec. 3, 4

title: Bangalore Apartments’ Federation urges for tabling KAOMA in the upcoming Belagavi session of legislature
content: The Bangalore Apartments’ Federation (BAF), representing over 1,400 apartment and villa resident welfare associations (RWAs), has urged the State government to table and implement the Karnataka Apartment Ownership and Management Act (KAOMA) during the Winter Session of the legislature in Belagavi

title: Court declines CBI plea for judicial custody of Shangloo in 1989 kidnapping case: lawyer
content: Mr. Shangloo was arrested in Srinagar on Dec. 1 on charges of involvement in the kidnapping of Rubaiyya Sayeed; his lawyer says no evidence was provided in the chargesheet against the accused

title: Court frees CBI's catch in Rubaiya abduction case, cites charge-sheet gap
content: shafat Ahmed Shangloo is accused of conspiring with incarcerated JKLF chief Yasin and others to abduct and barter her freedom with the release of five associates from jail . he is being tried in the Rubaiya abduction case and a 1990 terrorist attack in which four unarmed IAF personnel in Srinagar were killed .

title: Tackling Kerala’s mental health challenge
content: e-Paper The View From India Looking at World Affairs from the Indian perspective . first day first show news and reviews from the world of cinema and streaming . the weekly newsletter from science writers takes the jargon out of science and puts the fun in!

title: Drop list: It's time to move on from these four players
content: some of the biggest movers from the Oct. 31 fantasy rankings to last week's update . some of these "difference-makers" have made exactly one difference: sinking your team . "i'm not mad ... just disappointed," ranked 129 on Oct. 31, 270 last week .

title: Rajasthan: Tank sinks in canal during Army drill; jawan killed
content: the incident occurred during a training exercise aimed at practising how to cross the canal with armoured vehicles . the army was yet to issue a formal statement regarding the circumstances surrounding the accident or the identity of the deceased jawan .

title: 2026 recruiting class rankings: How Lane Kiffin, other new coaches are faring
content: the early signing period will bring some closure to the 2026 class with a large majority of recruits signing over the next few days . Lane Kiffin inherits a strong class built on in-state talent and led by the no. 1 overall prospect, DL Lamar Brown .

title: ✍ Grading college football head coaching hires
content: the wildest college football coaching cycle -- perhaps ever -- has reached the hiring phase . schools around the Power 4 that fired their coaches in the first two months of the season are targeting candidates and finalizing deals . one of the first major coaches to lose his job was the first noninterim coach to be hired .

title: RS sends Manipur GST bill to Lok Sabha amid walkout by oppn over SIR
content: finance minister says the bill proposes crucial reforms based on steps such as track-and-trace system . the bill replaces an ordinance to implem-ent GST reforms in the state . opposition parties staged a walkout over the govt not providing a timeline .

title: Texas is UConn's biggest threat -- and four more takeaways from the opening month
content: three top-five teams clashed in the 2025-26 women's college basketball season . last season's final four teams have shown they are the favorites to get back to the final weekend . defending national champion UConn is still holding on to the top spot in the rankings .

title: How USC landed the No. 1 class and relaunched a recruiting powerhouse
content: a general manager was hired in 2024 by the head coach and athletic director of the Trojans . they interviewed a vast pool of candidates, rising personnel stars across the power 4 and NFL ranks . the search continued into the fall of 2024, dragging all the way through the program's 7-6 finish .

title: All-Star predictions: Which stars will we see in USA vs. the World?
content: the first selection process for the new USA vs. the world format this season will work almost the same as it has in the past . if the class of 24 All-Stars doesn't split perfectly into 16 american and eight international players . commissioner Adam Silver will add extra players to the roster to meet those minimums .

title: MLB offseason grades: Reliever Devin Williams joins Mets after rough season with Yankees
content: the 2025-26 offseason is officially here, and we have you covered with grades and analysis for every major signing and trade this winter . if you're a big-money free agent signing that changes the course of your team's future, check back in for the freshest analysis through spring training .

title: Illegal migrants have no legal rights, says SC; rejects ‘refugee’ tag for Rohingyas
content: intruders and illegal immigrants have no legal right in northeastern and eastern states . apex court is adopting a humane approach towards them . the court said the poor have priority over illegal migrants . they claim right to food and shelter and help for children .

title: CFP Bubble Watch: Who's in? Who's out? Who needs help to make the bracket
content: Paul Finebaum says the 12-team college football playoff will be messier than ever . if both BYU and Texas Tech are in from the Big 12, someone currently in the top 10 is out . how the committee votes in the fifth ranking will be a strong indicator of how the field will look on Selection Day .

title: ACC/SEC Challenge guide: What to watch in Florida-Duke, UNC-Kentucky, more
content: the 2025 ACC/SEC men's challenge will be the first of three ranked matchups over the two-day event, followed by no. 16 North Carolina at No. 18 Kentucky later that night then no. 6 Louisville at no. 25 Arkansas on Wednesday . ESPN's Jeff Borzello and Myron Medcalf preview six of the top games to watch over the next 48 hours below .

title: Bracketology: Michigan is the new No. 1 overall seed?!
content: headline no. 2: Michigan is really, really good, making the handful of us who picked the Wolverines to win it all feel positively splendid . they sit atop the season's first NET rankings, and most others of note .

title: Solak spins Week 13 forward: Panic levels for the Steelers, Eagles, Colts, Ravens and Lions
content: the Steelers should move on from Mike Tomlin after an embarrassing home loss to the Bills . if any of you hit my editors late, I'll be coming over with bad intentions . we'll seek measured reactions to everyone's overreactions, celebrate the exciting stuff nobody is appreciating .

title: NFL odds: Bears underdogs at Packers, Ravens favored over Steelers
content: the Dallas Cowboys visit the Detroit Lions as underdogs on "Thursday Night Football" the cowboys have back-to-back wins over the Philadelphia Eagles and Kansas City Chiefs . the Lions are coming off a loss at home to the Green Bay Packers .

title: WWE 'Raw' takeaways: Liv Morgan takes over
content: the first "Raw" after Survivor Series began a season that will lead us to WrestleMania in April . the identity of the masked man who interfered at the end of the men's WarGames match wasn't close to being uncovered . neither was the next challenger to the women's tag team titles .

title: What do the Big Six PL teams need to do ahead of January's transfer window?
content: the transfer window opens for business in just under a month, on Jan. 1 2026 . arsenal are attempting to hold off the chasing pack to win a first title since 2004 . city and Chelsea are both close enough to the Gunners to overtake Mikel Arteta's side .

title: Where Kentucky ranks among the open Power 4 jobs
content: all four power conferences have had a firing in the first half of the season . the ouster of James Franklin sent a message around the sport: Almost no coach is safe . there are now nine schools looking for head coaches: UCLA, Cal, and now Michigan State .

title: After 5 years, HC allows PDP legislator to travel within India
content: waheed Parra allowed to travel within the country, modifying the earlier bail condition restricting him to J&K . he welcomed the order but rued the painful half-decade-long wait . "you begin to understand the meaning of freedom only when it is taken from you," he said .

title: Parry wanted to quit crime, so Lawrence had him killed: Kin
content: ANI photo Pawan Tiwari is a Principal Correspondent and joined The Times of India in 2017. He covers crime and district courts of Chandigarh. He loves traveling, trekking and leafing through books Read More

title: India to soon commission 3rd nuclear submarine with ballistic missiles: Navy chief
content: the third such submarine, called SSBN in naval parlance, is in “the final stages of trials and will be commissioned soon” as INS Aridhaman, navy chief Admiral Dinesh K Tripathi said . sources said the fourth such submarine (codenamed S-4*) will also have a displacement of 7,000-tonne . the first two INS Arihant and INS Arighaat became fully operational in 2018 and 2024 .

title: Hoax bomb threat: Hyderabad flight diverted to Mumbai; RGIA police registers a case
content: He has been reporting crime, courts, politics, transport, and civic issues for 18 years. Currently working for The Times of India as an Assistant Editor in Hyderabad. He has worked with the Delhi-NCR edition of the Times of India in the past. He has also have audio-visual media and research experience. Read More

title: Indian scientists discover ancient galaxy ‘surprisingly similar to Milky Way’
content: astronomers use the powerful James Webb Space Telescope to find spiral galaxies . the galaxy is located 12 billion light years away and is 30,000 light years across . they say the galaxy formed when the Universe was only 1.5 billion years old . their discovery challenges known models of galaxy formation .

title: Omar's deputy Surinder Choudhary moves Delhi HC over audio 'sex tape' on social media
content: a video clip of a conversation with "sexual undertones" is being circulated with a static image of the deputy CM . a judge ordered google and Meta to provide details of the channels and pages circulating the content . the court ordered the channels to provide the names, IP addresses and all available details .

title: Haryana sports dept gives itself clean chit in deaths of teen basketballers
content: Sat Singh is a senior Journalist based at Rohtak. He has over two decades of experience working in mainstream media and works on development, culture, women issues, Jat politics, khap panchayats and village-level initiatives Read More
